flawed_nl_solution:
Through March, Dr. Banks gave out 53 + 67 + 46 = <<53+67+46=166>>166 toothbrushes.
Before giving away toothbrushes in April, he had 330 -166 = <<330-166=168>>168 toothbrushes remaining.
Between April and May, he gave out the remaining 168 / 2 = <<168/2=84>>84 toothbrushes each month.
The difference would be 84- 46 = <<84-46=38>>38 more toothbrushes in the busiest month.
#### 38

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 164, not 168. This appears to be a minor miscalculation.
